briefTitle: EFECAB: Improving Pig Management to Prevent Epilepsy in Burkina Faso
officialTitle: EFECAB: Improving Pig Management to Prevent Epilepsy in Burkina Faso

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
The unit of randomization and analysis of this study is the village. Therefore, the eligibility criteria were determined at the village level.

Inclusion Criteria:

* Population of at least 1000 at the 2006 census
* Present on the map of the "Institut GÃ©ographique du Burkina 2000"
* Separated from another village by at least 5 kilometers.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Village located on a National or Provincial road
* Village located within 20 km of Koudougou or Ouagadougou
* Regional or Provincial Capital
* Absence of pigs in the village

At the individual level, the following eligibility criteria were used:

Inclusion Criteria:

* Aged 5 years old or more
* Has lived in the village for at least 12 months
* Not planning to move in the next three years

Exclusion Criteria:

* Presence of confirmed epilepsy or progressively worsening severe chronic headaches at baseline.

primary.description: Sero conversion to the AgELISA test to detect antigens of cysticercosis
primary.timeFrame: baseline, 18 months follow-up pre randomization, 18 months follow-up post randomization

secondary.description: Sero-positivity to the AgELISA test to detect antigens of cysticercosis
secondary.timeFrame: baseline, 18 months follow-up pre randomization, 18 months follow-up post randomization

secondary.measure: Change in knowledge, attitude and practices
secondary.description: Change in answers to the questionnaire through time
secondary.timeFrame: baseline, 18 months follow-up pre randomization, 18 months follow-up post randomization

secondary.measure: Cumulative incidence of epilepsy and progressively worsening severe chronic headaches
secondary.description: development of neurological disorders among those followed up at least twice
secondary.timeFrame: baseline, 18 months follow-up pre randomization, 18 months follow-up post randomization

secondary.description: Attitudes and knowledge regarding epilepsy post randomization
